p: The essential oils were diluted 1:99 ( v/ v) in methanol and analyzed for their chemical composition through GC–MS using an Agilent 7890A/5975MSD system (Agilent Technologies, Inc., Santa Clara, CA, USA) equipped with a HP-5MS capillary column (30 m × 0.25 mm i.d × 0.25 μm film thickness). The carrier gas, helium, was injected at a constant flow rate of 1.0 mL/min. The injector temperature was 250 °C. The sample (1 μL) was injected in the split mode (1:25). The oven temperature was initially 60 °C, was subsequently raised to 280 °C at 3 °C/min, and was then maintained at 280 °C for 70 min. The mass spectrometer was operated at an ionization voltage of 70 eV and a mass range of 35–400 m/ z. The chemical constituents were identified by matching their retention time locking to n-pentadecane (at 27.500 min) and mass spectra with those obtained from the Flavor2.L, Wiley7n.1, and NIST98.L mass spectrum databases. The relative percentage of individual constituents was calculated on the basis of the gas chromatography peak area.
